alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Marion and south central Putnam Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lake George to 6 miles south of Fort McCoy to near Williston. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Sparr, Anthony, Reddick, Flemington, Lowell and Burbank. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Marion
